intro: Paepalanthus pullus, commonly known as the Brazilian sunflower, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling a sunflower. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in open areas such as grasslands and disturbed sites. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
